trapomino

Class Monkey

  • java.lang.Object
    • trapomino.Animal
      • trapomino.Monkey

  • public class Monkey
extends Animal
    This class creates and manages the Grid Position, direction, and movement of a Monkey.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Monkey(int x, int y, Grid grid)
      This Monkey constructor defines the necessary variables for use in the Monkey class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void move()
      This method manages the movement of the Monkey, the Monkey will move every 45 ticks and will wait 3 iterations after moving again for 3 iterations in a row.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monkey

        public Monkey(int x,
              int y,
              Grid grid)
        This Monkey constructor defines the necessary variables for use in the Monkey class.
        Parameters:
        x - - the X coordinate where the Monkey's sprite should be drawn
        y - - the Y coordinate where the Monkey's sprite should be drawn
        grid - - the grid to place the Monkey on

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        This method manages the movement of the Monkey, the Monkey will move every 45 ticks and will wait 3 iterations after moving again for 3 iterations in a row. The method will first check if the Monkey can move to the space above it, if so, it moves up. If the Monkey can not climb, it will try to move to the adjacent block in its current direction. Finally, if it can not move horizontally or vertically, the Monkey will change direction.
        Specified by:
        move in class Animal
